Uses of Class
fast3d.math.Vector4d

  • Packages that use Vector4d 
    Package Description
    fast3d.graphics  
    fast3d.math  
    fast3d.util  
    fast3d.util.serial  

    • Uses of Vector4d in fast3d.graphics

      Subclasses of Vector4d in fast3d.graphics 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Color
      a color in 3d-space is represented by 4 values: r(red),g(green),b(blue) and alpha(transparency) in the rgba-model, but the values of r,g,b and alpha have to in the interval [0d,1d]
      used for lighting and general coloring in a 3d-graphics-context
      Constructors in fast3d.graphics with parameters of type Vector4d 
      Constructor and Description
      Color(Vector4d res)
      constructs a color-model, r,g,b,a as declared by x,y,z,a in the given vector3d

    • Uses of Vector4d in fast3d.math

      Methods in fast3d.math that return Vector4d 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Vector4d Vector4d.a()
      creates an independent vector with 1 as a-coordinate and 0 as all other coordinates
      Vector4d Vector4d.add(Vector4d t)
      adds the coordinates of the parameter to the coordinates of this
      does not change the parameter
      static Vector4d Vector4d.calculateAverage(Vector4d... vecs)
      the average vector is:
      does not change the parameter
      the center position (if the given vectors were interpreted as positions) the middle-direction (if the given vectors were interpreted as directions)
      Vector4d Vector4d.clone() 
      Vector4d Vector4d.constrain(double min, double max)
      constrains the coordinates to the given range
      if a coordinate is lower than min, it will be set to min
      if a coordinate is higher than max, it will be set to max
      after this method call all coordinates will be within the interval [min,max], including the limits
      Vector4d Vector4d.constrainLength(double min, double max)
      constrains the length to the given range
      if this length is lower than min, it will be scaled to min
      if this length is higher than max, it will be scaled to max
      Vector4d Vector4d.invert()
      inverts this vector
      this will point in the opposite direction, but with the same length
      Vector4d Vector4d.multiply(Vector4d t)
      multiplies the coordinates of the parameter to the coordinates of this
      does not change the parameter
      Vector4d Vector4d.normalize()
      scales the vector to the length 1
      fails (does nothing than) for the zero-vector
      static Vector4d Vector4d.one() 
      static Vector4d Vector4d.random() 
      Vector4d Vector4d.scale(double k)
      enlarges the vector by k, it's direction will be constant
      for k between 0 and 1, the vector will be shortened
      for negative k the vector will be inverted and then enlarged by positive k
      Vector4d Vector4d.scaleTo(double length)
      scales this vector to the length of the parameter-vector, but will not change this direction
      Vector4d Vector4d.scaleTo(Vector4d compare)
      scales this vector to the length of the parameter-vector, but will not change this direction
      the parameter will not be changed
      Vector4d Vector4d.set(double x, double y, double z, double a)
      copies the coordinates of the parameter to this
      Vector4d Vector4d.set(Vector4d t)
      copies the coordinates of the parameter to this
      does not change the parameter
      Vector4d Vector4d.setCoordinates(double[] vec)
      counterpart to getCoordinates
      sets the coordinates of this to x=[0], y=[1], z=[2], a=[3]
      Vector4d Vector4d.setToZero()
      sets all coordinates to 0
      Vector4d Vector4d.sub(Vector4d t)
      subtracts the coordinates of the parameter from the coordinates of this
      does not change the parameter
      Vector4d Vector4d.to(Vector4d t)
      does not change the parameter
      static Vector4d Vector4d.x()
      creates an independent vector with 1 as x-coordinate and 0 as all other coordinates
      static Vector4d Vector4d.y()
      creates an independent vector with 1 as y-coordinate and 0 as all other coordinates
      static Vector4d Vector4d.z()
      creates an independent vector with 1 as z-coordinate and 0 as all other coordinates
      static Vector4d Vector4d.zero() 
      Methods in fast3d.math with parameters of type Vector4d 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector4d Vector4d.add(Vector4d t)
      adds the coordinates of the parameter to the coordinates of this
      does not change the parameter
      double Vector4d.angleTo(Vector4d v)
      calculates the angle between this and the parameter-vector in radiant
      both vectors are direction-vectors and for that calculation interpreted as arrows laying on the 4d-space-origin
      does not change the parameter
      static Vector4d Vector4d.calculateAverage(Vector4d... vecs)
      the average vector is:
      does not change the parameter
      the center position (if the given vectors were interpreted as positions) the middle-direction (if the given vectors were interpreted as directions)
      double Vector4d.distanceTo(Vector4d target)
      calculates the length of the difference vector given by to(target)
      does not change the parameter
      double Vector4d.distanceToSquared(Vector4d target)
      calculates the square of the length of the difference vector given by to(target)
      does not change the parameter
      double Vector4d.dotP(Vector4d v)
      calculates the dot-product of this and the parameter
      does not change both the parameter or this
      static double Vector4d.dotP(Vector4d a, Vector4d b)
      the dot product of two vectors is an double that can represent part of the angle between the parameters
      the dotP is positive if the angle between the vectors is pointed, a negative value otherwise
      if the parameter-vectors are orthogonal, the result will be 0
      it does not matter in which order the parameters are given
      static double Vector4d.getRatio(Vector4d a, Vector4d b)
      returns the ratio between the two given parallel vectors or Double.NaN if they are not parallel
      if given vectors a and b the ratio is defined as:
      a = ratio * b so that ratio = a / b;
      static boolean Vector4d.isFinite(Vector4d v)
      checks whether the given vector is not null and all it's coordinates are finite
      boolean Vector4d.isParallel(Vector4d v)
      checks, whether the parameter-vector has the same direction
      it may have another length
      does not change the parameter
      boolean Vector4d.isSameOrientated(Vector4d v)
      checks, whether the parameter-vector has the same direction and orientation
      it may have another length
      does not change the parameter
      Vector4d Vector4d.multiply(Vector4d t)
      multiplies the coordinates of the parameter to the coordinates of this
      does not change the parameter
      Vector4d Vector4d.scaleTo(Vector4d compare)
      scales this vector to the length of the parameter-vector, but will not change this direction
      the parameter will not be changed
      Vector4d Vector4d.set(Vector4d t)
      copies the coordinates of the parameter to this
      does not change the parameter
      Vector4d Vector4d.sub(Vector4d t)
      subtracts the coordinates of the parameter from the coordinates of this
      does not change the parameter
      Vector4d Vector4d.to(Vector4d t)
      does not change the parameter

    • Uses of Vector4d in fast3d.util

      Methods in fast3d.util with parameters of type Vector4d 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Color ColorGen.fromVector(Vector4d vec)
      just copies the xyza-values to rgba, if the are in range of 0d to 1d
      if they are out of range they are constraint: all values over 1 are set to 1, all values under 0 are set to 0

    • Uses of Vector4d in fast3d.util.serial

      Methods in fast3d.util.serial that return Vector4d 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vector4d VecBinaryReader.read4()
      reads the vectors double-coordinates and generates a single vector from them
      Vector4d[] VecBinaryReader.read4(int amount)
      reads all needed double-coordinates and generates vectors of them
      Methods in fast3d.util.serial with parameters of type Vector4d 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean VecBinaryWriter.write(Vector4d... vecs)
      serializes and writes all given vectors to the stream
      in fact this does just write the coordinates of the given vectors as doubles
